ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: DATA=SAS-data-set] 
      
Identifies the input SAS data set.

[Syntax: FORMCHAR<(position(s))>='formatting-character(s)']
      
Defines the characters to use for constructing the horizontal and vertical axes, 
reference lines, and other structural parts of a chart. It also defines the symbols 
to use to create the bars, blocks, or sections in the output.

position(s): identifies the position of one or more characters in the SAS 
formatting-character string. A space or a comma separates the positions.

formatting-character(s): lists the characters to use for the specified positions.

Tip: You can use any character in formatting-characters, including hexadecimal characters. 
If you use hexadecimal characters, then you must put an x after the closing quotation mark. 
For example: formchar(2,7)='2D7C

Specifies the proportions of PIE and STAR charts. 
The value is determined by: (lines per inch / columns per inch) * 10

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: BLOCK variable(s) </ option(s)>;
      
Produces a block chart.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Prints the bars and any associated statistics in ascending order of size within groups.

[Syntax: AXIS=value-expression] 
          
Specifies the values for the response axis, where value-expression is a list of individual
values, each separated by a space, or a range with a uniform interval for the values.
Prints the cumulative frequency.
Prints the cumulative percentages.
Prints the bars and any associated statistics in descending order of size within groups.
Specifies that a numeric chart variable is discrete rather than continuous.

Specifies that a numeric chart variable is discrete rather than continuous. Without 
DISCRETE, PROC CHART assumes that all numeric variables are continuous and 
automatically chooses intervals for them unless you use MIDPOINTS= or LEVELS=.

[Syntax: FREQ=variable] 
          
Specifies a data set variable that represents a frequency count for each observation.

[Syntax: GROUP=variable] 
          
Produces side-by-side charts, with each chart representing the observations that 
have a common value for the GROUP= variable.

[Syntax: GSPACE=n] 
          
Specifies the amount of extra space between groups of bars. Use GSPACE=0 to leave 
no extra space between adjacent groups of bars.
Specifies that the sum of percentages for each group equals 100.

[Syntax: LEVELS=number-of-midpoints] 
          
Specifies the number of bars that represent each chart variable when the variables 
are continuous.
Prints the mean of the observations represented by each bar.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies midpoints, either individually, or across a range at a uniform interval.   Examples: vbar x / midpoints=10 20 30 40 50; vbar x / midpoints='JAN' 'FEB' 'MAR'; vbar x / midpoints=10 to 100 by 5;
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies an algorithm that PROC CHART used in previous versions of SAS to choose  midpoints for continuous variables.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies that missing values are valid levels for the chart variable.
Suppresses the default header line printed at the top of a chart.
Allow no space between vertical bars.
Suppresses the statistics on a horizontal bar chart.
Suppresses printing of the subgroup symbol or legend table.
Suppresses any bar with zero frequency.
Prints the percentages of observations having a given value for the chart variable.

[Syntax: REF=value(s)] 
          
Draws reference lines on the response axis at the specified positions.

[Syntax: SPACE=n] 
          
Specifies the amount of space between individual bars.

[Syntax: SUBGROUP=variable] 
          
Subdivides each bar or block into characters that show the contribution of the values 
of variable to that bar or block. PROC CHART uses the first character of each value to 
fill in the portion of the bar or block that corresponds to that value, unless more 
than one value begins with the same first character.
Prints the total number of observations that each bar represents.

[Syntax: SUMVAR=variable] 
          
Specifies the variable for which either values or means (depending on the value of TYPE=) 
PROC CHART displays in the chart.

[Syntax: SYMBOL=character(s)] 
          
Specifies the character or characters that PROC CHART uses in the bars or blocks of the 
chart when you do not use the SUBGROUP= option.
Specifies what statistic the bars or sections in the chart represent.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that each bar, block, or section represent the cumulative frequency.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that each bar, block, or section represent the cumulative percentage.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies that each bar, block, or section represent the frequency with which a value or range occurs for the chart variable in the data.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Specifies that each bar, block, or section represent the mean of the SUMVAR= variable across all observations that belong to that bar, block, or section.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Specifies that each bar, block, or section represent the percentage of observations that have a given value or that fall into a given range of the chart variable.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Specifies that each bar, block, or section represent the sum of the SUMVAR= variable for the observations that correspond to each bar, block, or section.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: WIDTH=n] 
          
Specifies the width of the bars on bar charts.

StatementHelp.#cdata: Processes separately for each BY group.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that 
immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.
Specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: HBAR variable(s) </ option(s)>;
      
Produces a horizontal bar chart.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Prints the bars and any associated statistics in ascending order of size within groups.
